name: Jelly Beans
overview: Jelly Beans is a memory game coded entirely in BASIC for the Commodore 64. Guess the amount of jelly beans on the screen then type your guess in once the blank screen with plain text appears, you only have a certain amount of time to count the beans, so be careful. Developed by Timothy Orr Knight and Darren LaBatt and published as a type in listing from the book "Commodore 64 BASIC Programs" in 1983.
